properties.headline: Lakeshore Flood Warning issued February 12 at 3:00PM CST until February 14 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Chicago IL
properties.description:
* WHAT...Significant lakeshore flooding is expected. Strong
north to north-northwest winds of 25 to 30 mph with gusts up
to 35 to 40 mph will build waves to 10 to 14 feet with
occasional waves up to 18 feet.

* WHERE...Shoreline areas of Lake and Porter Counties in Indiana.

* WHEN...Thursday morning through Thursday evening.

* IMPACTS...The winds and large battering waves combined with
record high lake levels could exacerbate already significant
beach and shoreline erosion sustained in the past several
months. Vulnerable structures along the shore may be heavily
damaged. The water will likely threaten some roads near the
lake, including Lakefront Drive in the Beverly Shores area of
Porter County. In addition, low lying and flood prone areas
including Whiting Lakefront Park will also likely be impacted.
Large waves may sweep onlookers into the lake.
properties.instruction:
A Lakeshore Flood Warning means that flooding is occurring or
imminent along the lake. Residents on or near the shore in the
warned area should be alert for rising water...and take
appropriate action to protect life and property.

NWSheadline: LAKESHORE FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM THURSDAY TO MIDNIGHT CST THURSDAY NIGHT
